title: Amendment to the Code of Criminal Procedure (Special Provisions) Act, No.2 of 2013 (Rights of Detainees - Access to Legal Counsel)
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet was granted previously to publish the draft Bill submitted to amend the Code of Criminal Procedure (Special Provisions) Act, No.2 of 2013 to ensure the right of a detainee in custody to access the services of a Legal Counsel   in the Government Gazette and to present it in Parliament for approval. Further, approval was also granted to present the amendments proposed in respect of the draft Bill at the Committee Stage in Parliament.  

	Prior to resubmitting the Revised Draft Bill in Parliament a series of discussions had been held with the Attorney General's Department, Sri Lanka Police, the Bar Association of Sri Lanka and the relevant stakeholders, and  the Revised Draft Bill, has been unanimously accepted. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice, to publish the said Revised Draft Bill initially to be operative for four (04) years, in the Government Gazette, to be implemented and subsequently, to present it in Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.
